Empires & Puzzles Pepperbleu Review: The Mothician's Deadly Touch

Pepperbleu brings a unique blend of heavy hitting and heavy hindering to the battlefield. With her Dusk Mothling Mega Fiend and Safe Dispel, she's a surgical tool for dissecting the toughest defenses. But is her Average speed a liability in today's Fast meta? Let's find out.

Pepperbleu, affectionately dubbed "The Mothician" by her creators, is a 5-star Ice (Blue) hero from the Moth family, released during the Alliance Quest event in early 2025. As a Wizard, she specializes in surgical strikes—delivering a potent mix of direct damage, safe dispelling, and one of the most debilitating parasitic mechanics in the game: the Mega Fiend. While she initially faced criticism for her Average speed, subsequent balance updates have cemented her as a formidable tactical nuke, designed to shut down key targets and keep them down. She might look like she belongs in a whimsical fairy tale, but her bite is significantly worse than her flutter.

Visually, Pepperbleu is a stunning addition to the Moth family, embracing a whimsical "Mothician" aesthetic. Clad in deep blues and fuzzy textures that mimic moth anatomy, she strikes a pose that is equal parts magical girl and mischievous trickster. The art direction leans heavily into the fantasy element, distinguishing her from the grittier warriors of other families. The color palette screams "Ice hero," but the soft, glowing effects of her moths hint at the insidious nature of her special skill—beautiful, until it starts eating your health bar.

With a base power of 1185 (rising to 1433 at LB2), Pepperbleu sits comfortably in the upper echelon of stats, though she trails slightly behind the absolute cutting-edge heroes released in late 2025 (who are pushing 1600+ attack). Her distribution is well-balanced, with an attack stat that ensures her direct damage and Fiend DoT sting, and enough bulk to survive long enough to fire at Average speed. While not a stat monster compared to the December 2025 releases, she is far from fragile.
"Dusk Till Dawn" is a multi-stage dismantling of a single enemy.
Dealing 450% damage is substantial, especially off her high attack stat. This allows her to function as a sniper, potentially finishing off weakened foes.
the hit (mechanically, the order can be tricky, see "Weaknesses"). Safe dispel is premium utility, bypassing "on dispel" effects like damage or mana gain.

This is the star of the show. The Dusk Mothling Mega Fiend deals 270% attack damage per turn—a massive bleed. More importantly, it absorbs healing equal to 75% of the target's max health. On a modern tank with 3000+ HP, that’s a healing shield of over 2000 HP that needs to be healed
As long as the Fiend is active, the target cannot receive new buffs. This effectively neuters support heroes and tanks who rely on taunt, defense up, or regeneration.
Let's break down the math behind the Mothician:
Average. She needs 10 tiles to charge, or 9 with a lvl 23 Mana Troop/lvl 11 Magic Troop (assuming no other bonuses). This makes her slower than the "Fast" meta, requiring careful board play.
At LB2 (approx. 1516 Attack), a 450% hit deals roughly
(before defense reduction). Against a hero with ~1400 defense, this typically translates to a hefty 800-1000+ damage impact.
The Mega Fiend deals 270% damage every turn. Using the same LB2 stats, that's significant recurring damage that ignores defense buffs (DoT usually does).
If a target has 3000 Max HP, the Fiend absorbs
worth of healing. This is functionally a death sentence for healers who rely on small, incremental ticks. Only massive burst healers or specific "remove fiend" skills can easily dislodge it.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Moth family brings specific survival tools to the table.
The Moth family bonus typically supports survivability or mana control, reinforcing the "annoyance" factor of these heroes.

A 15% chance to dodge special skill damage is a simple but effective survival layer. It won't save her every time, but when it procs against a sniper, it can swing a match. Note that this is a "Dodge Damage" passive, not a full "Dodge Status Effects" passive, meaning she might still take the ailment even if she dodges the damage, depending on the specific enemy wording.
For the first 6 turns of battle, Pepperbleu is immune to status ailments. This is
for an Average speed hero. It protects her from mana control, silence, and blind during the crucial opening phase, practically guaranteeing she will fire her special skill at least once.
When released, Pepperbleu was viewed with skepticism due to her Average speed in a Fast-dominated game. However, after receiving buffs that added direct damage to her kit, she found her footing.
By late 2025 standards, her 450% hit is "good" but not "game-breaking" for a single target at Average speed (where some hit 3 for similar numbers).
Her value lies not in raw DPS, but in

. The Mega Fiend remains one of the hardest counters to healers and buffers. In Rush Attack wars or tournaments, she is a terror. In standard raids, she is a high-skill cap hero used to dissect specific defenses (e.g., locking down a Taunt tank). She remains relevant in top-tier play primarily as a counter-pick rather than a universal defense team anchor.
At the time of writing, Pepperbleu does not have a costume.
As a Wizard, Pepperbleu benefits from the
talent, which gives a chance to deal extra damage on standard attacks against enemies with buffs. However, her primary role is Special Skill impact.
Fiend damage is based on the caster's attack stats.
A higher attack stat means a deadlier Fiend every single turn.
Slightly squishier, relying on her Passive Dodge and Aether Power to survive.

is the only logical choice. The scaling on her Fiend damage and her sniper hit demands high attack power to be effective. Her defensive stats are sufficient at base levels for an Average speed hero, especially with her start-of-battle immunity.
The 75% HP healing absorption is arguably the strongest anti-heal in the game, forcing enemies to waste massive resources to clear it.
Prevents the target from re-buffing, which is critical against heroes like Gooric or other self-sustaining tanks.
Removes buffs safely (mostly), preventing nasty on-dispel triggers.
Guarantees she isn't silenced or mana-slowed before her first cast.
dispelling. This makes her incredibly vulnerable to
heroes. If she hits a hero with active Reposte, she will take massive damage (and likely die) before the dispel triggers.

If the target has a Mega Minion, her 450% damage hits the minion first (often wasted), and then her Mega Fiend replaces the Mega Minion. While removing the Mega Minion is good, you lose the "kill potential" of the snipe.
In a world of Very Fast/Fast heroes, she can sometimes be too slow to stop a cascading enemy offense.
She offers zero board control or AoE damage. If the board is bad, she impacts only one enemy at a time.
At Very Fast speed, she is a nightmare. She can lock down an enemy hero instantly with a Fiend that they likely cannot heal off.
Her high attack stat and ability to block buffs (like defense up on the Titan) make her solid, though the Fiend animation eats time.
Excellent for dismantling teams centered around a single annoying tank (like a Healer or Taunter).
Great for boss stages where bosses heal or buff themselves frequently.
Pepperbleu works best when she doesn't have to carry the damage load alone. She is a
Pair her with other Fiend summoners or anti-healers (like Matilda or water-based heroes). Overwhelming the enemy with Fiends ensures they die to DoT while unable to recover.
Kiril buffs, Lord Loki copies a dangerous enemy skill, and Pepperbleu neutralizes the biggest threat remaining.
Pair with other Dodge heroes (like C. Kadilen or generic Rogue heroes). Her passive combined with a Dodge buffer makes the team incredibly slippery.
As mentioned, hitting them is suicide for Pepperbleu.
If her special is dodged, the Fiend is not applied.
Be careful not to overwrite your own team's mechanics, though this applies more to enemies. Against enemies, she is a counter
Mega Minions, but hitting them feels bad for damage output.
Heroes that specifically replace Fiends with Minions or provide massive healing boosts can sometimes cleanse the Mothling faster than expected.

If you pulled Pepperbleu early, she is a fantastic "boss killer" for map stages. Her Fiend will drain boss HP rapidly while preventing them from buffing. In raids, use her to target the enemy healer—if you land the Fiend, that healer becomes useless. Prioritize leveling her Attack stat to maximize the Fiend's potency.
She is a luxury tool. You don't
her for every war, but when you see a heavy healing tank or a annoying buffer, she is the key. Is she worth Alpha Aethers?
, but mostly for the Ailment Immunity stat boost. The 6-turn immunity solves her biggest weakness (Average speed vulnerability). If you face heavy stalling defenses, she is your solution.
The community's relationship with Pepperbleu has been a rollercoaster.
Initially, players were disappointed. "The hero as described seems underwhelming for Average speed," one user noted.

After she received direct damage in her kit, sentiment flipped. "I dunno what kind of heroes one may have, but her buffing now with 400% damage prior to implanting a fiend is what she was looking for," remarked a forum user.

Her visual design won hearts even when her skills were lacking. "Nice card to look, terrible to play. All style no substance," was a common early sentiment that has since been proven wrong by her buffs.
Players keenly noted the flaw in her skill order: "The biggest being that her damage is pointless if you hit a hero with a MM since it absorbs the damage and then is replaced by the fiend."

Pepperbleu is a classic example of a "glow-up" hero. What started as a confusing support piece has evolved into a lethal precision instrument. She won't wipe a whole team in one go, but she will ensure that the most annoying enemy on the field simply... stops existing. She demands smart targeting and timing, but the reward is watching a 3000 HP tank wither away, unable to heal or buff, eaten alive by the cutest parasite in the game.
A top-tier tactical sniper. Keep her away from Riposte, and she'll carry you to victory.
